Buy more, buy more now. Buy and be happy.\n Our time is yours.\n Do it for the fat lady.\n From this moment we travel together East. Always to the East.\n Stay away from normal people. They\'re stupid.\n To what do we owe the extreme pleasure of this surprising visit?\n Klaatu barada nikto.\n Wake up, we\'re here. Why are you shaking? Are you okay?\n Your mission was to retrieve Dr. Durand Durand from Tau Ceti!\n Out here on the perimeter there are no stars.\n I only can see in black and white…\n I don\'t know why you gotta be so undemanding.\n You need chaos inside to give birth to a dancing star.\n Involving yourself in status quo creativity is counter-revolutionary!\n We constructed pyramids in honour of our escaping.\n No eternal reward will forgive us now for wasting the dawn.\n Can\'t live without a spinal cord, son.\n Kain refused the sacrifice.\n Now how about cuttin the rebop?\n There may be other universes, but ours seems to be based on war and games.\n Silence, experience shows, is what terrifies people most.\n If ever told to look at yourself…never look.\n Never create anything. It will be misinterpreted. It will chain you and follow you for the rest of your life. It will never change.\n All these worlds are yours except Europa. Attempt no landing there.\n Pay no attention to the man behind the curtain.\n Light all the fires, it\'s the king and he\'s coming home!\n You got more front than Brighton, coming back here!\n Sent out like sheep into the midst of wolves, be shrewd as serpents and innocent as doves.\n Specialization is for insects.\n I put on my robe and wizard hat.\n Why do I climb the mountain? Because I\'m in love.\n One day I saw a child playing with a ruby the size of a tangerine.\n Are you the keymaster?\n If you lived here, you\'d be home now.\n Stop your grinnin\' and drop your linen.\n Just a reminder: this villager does not endorse vigilante justice. Unless it gets results. Which it will!\n Looks like you picked the wrong week to quit smoking.\n I wish there was a way to know you were in the good old days before you actually left them.\n You look like hell.\n Gimme respect.\n S…s…senpai?\n Did I do thaaaaaat?\n Meep.\n Make sure to subscribe, retweet, like, share, and upvote this! Wait… What was I talking about?\n Two beers or not two beers, that\'s the question…\n What can I do, sometimes…\n Are you afraid to get dirty?\n What does breaking the 4th wall mean?\n AVADA KEDAVRA! …oops, wrong spell!\n Respect my authority!\n It could be worse, I could be at the hospital!\n Potatoes make French fries, chips and vodka. It\'s like the other vegetables aren\'t even trying…\n I found a scroll of stupidity yesterday, you should have it…\n On that day, mankind received a grim reminder…\n I\'m going to kill them all… every single one.\n Everything is impossible until someone does it.\n I have a cool bruise on my leg, do you want to see it?\n Everything is an adventure if you\'re always lost.\n All those moments will be lost in time, like tears in rain.\n Eat cheese or perish.\n I\'m here to kick gum and chew butt…wait, that\'s not right…\n I\'m against crime, and I\'m not ashamed to admit it.\n We all make choices in life, but in the end, our choices make us.\n A man who praises a man to his face is full of ulterior motives.\n I have no quest for you, farewell peasant.\n Kids, don\'t do bugs.\n Who is X and what is he going to give me?\n You will die here.\n I hate Common Cold, but with my luck, I think its at least Epic Cold.\n Just another lone soul seeking a purpose.\n A place that needs a hero is not a good place.\n Stand and deliver.\n We are all Stardust.\n I know the ways of the potato.\n Help! I\'m stuck in a video game!\n Good thing I\'m not an NPC, that would suck.\n I used to be an adventurer like you, but then I took an arrow to the knee.\n Sometimes, I dream about cheese.\n Error obtaining a quote;\n I wonder what that green light on the other side of the water is.\n Hmmmmmmmmmmm.\n Coss a toin to your Witcher.\n I kick ass for the Lord!\n Have you seen Archison? I need to talk to him about getting off this stupid island.\n What is a man but a miserable pile of secrets?\n Don\'t focus too much on the game or you\'ll take the wrong bus.

&font_cyan;Human&font_end; &font_red;Dwarf&font_end; &font_speed;Halfling&font_end; &font_green;Gnome&font_end; &font_gold;Elf&font_end; &font_black_low;Drow&font_end; &font_mushroom;Undead&font_end; &font_dark_green;Orc&font_end; &font_yellow;Lizard&font_end; &font_white;Unknown&font_end;
They are the most adaptable and flexible of the common races. Their alignment resides in the fine line between good and evil. They are balanced in fighting and magic and have an innate knowledge of crafting, and are natural explorers. They used to live under the mountains just caring about their mines and beers, but due to the recent spreading of evil in the world, many have started to explore the world to live their own legends like their ancestors did in the past. They are one of the strongest races, having great mining skills, and they are the only ones capable of crafting Beer. Even though they have appeared on books and stories, almost no one has seen one in their life, as Halflings are peaceful people who live in their own hidden villages, cooking, eating, reading about stories from the first era, and living all kinds of fantasy in their minds. Since evil has started spreading around the world, some of the most brave Halfling have started their own adventures like the ones they read on their books. They take delight in life, enjoying every moment of invention, exploration and investigation. They used to be focused just on their inventions, and exploration, but recently many brave Gnomes have been seen adventuring around the world. Elves are magical people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it. Selfish and egocentric, they are worried about their future due to the increased presence of evil, so they have started to become more present in the world in search for their salvation. Generally known as the evil version of the regular elves. They are extremely intelligent, charismatic and dexterous, but share surface elves\' comparative frailty and slight frames. They are characterized by white or silver hair and obsidian black skin. Once living humans brought to life in a horrifying state of undeath through the practice of necromantic magic. They have great strength and intelligence but lack of speed. Their hunger increases faster than the other races, but they can eat corpses to restore Mana, Hunger, and Health. Bestial and savage, orcs band together as trıbes, living on hunting and raiding. As lovers of war, they have found a great enemy in the evil that has recently spread around the world. They have started to relate to other races with whom they had only spoken in the language of weapons and magic not so long ago. They are semi-aquatic reptilian humanoids. Their skin was covered in scales and varied in color from dark green through to shades of brown and gray. The most brave of them have been travelling around the world, finding other places to expand their lifes and be able to help in the destruction of evil.
